text: UPDATED: OCT 5, 2015 On tap at 4:20 pub in Rome-Italy. Pours deep golden semi clear, minimal gassy bubbling foam lowering fast. Nose: passito wine, macerated grapes, fermentation. Mouth: wow! Really dry, sour, white wine, complex. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

My Bottom Line:
Nut skins, haystacks and prevalent mustiness lead to agreeable acidity in this pleasant Lambic experiment.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sheet of foam tops the blond haze.
-Drinkability is quite high.
-The soft bubbling and polite sourness make for an engaging mouthfeel.
-The Pineau des Charentes barrel doesnt seem to be doing as great work on the Boon base lambic as the Brunello barrel.

On cask at Brasserie 4:20.

On tap @ Gaasa. Golden body without any head. Funky, fruity and acidic lambic aroma. Flavor has a mild acidity, quite fruity, lemon and a sort of astringent bitterness. Nice and refreshing, not the toughest lambic in town but really nice and pleasent.
On tap at Gaasa. Deep golden colour with no head. Aroma is sourness, horse blanket, yeast. Flavour is sourness, horse blanket, yeast. Nice beer.

16/12/2011 Brasserie 4:20 (37 months old, on tap). Bevuta al Sour Winter Festival. Dorata, brillante, con riflessi ambrati chiari, schiuma assente. Aroma molto delicato, acido con note dolciastre date dal vino fortificato, e sfumature erbacee e balsamiche, di bosco. In bocca è acida, morbida ma allo stesso tempo complessa, con intense note erbacee e balsamiche sul finale. Corpo medio, consistenza vellutata, vinosa, di grande raffinatezza, carbonazione soft. Una carezza.

Hand pump at 4:20. Fruity, funky aroma of caramel and acid, wine and vinegar. Nice sweet and sour balance in the mouth: acid, vinegar, wine, or port, honey, wood and pepper. Excellent stuff. Complex and balanced.

On tap at Selezione Birra 2012, Rimini. Pours a golden clear color with no head whatsoever. Aroma is stunning and delicious: loads of fruityness mixed with acidic and vinegary notes. Taste is more "traditional" with horseblanket and funky notes mixed with sourness and some citrus and dust. No carbonation and oily body. Very nice one and super tasty.
A: Fruity, sour, herbal A: cloudy T: moderate sweetness, low sourness P: mb, flat O:16/20

Aroma is winy brett, quite smooth,
Flavour is watery sweet and sour wine with some spices. Very subtle.
Had this one at the ACBF 2011. Amber colored brew. Apple, moderate sourness, some sweetness. Ok.
At ACBF 2011.  Lambic aroma.  Gold haze colour with no head.  Lambic flavour.  Some wood, some stewed apple.  Tasty.  Just a little thin on the finish maybe.
4th March 2011  ACBF. Hazy amber beer, no real head. Light crisp, dry palate. Mild sourness. Light lemony acid. Some lactose sweetness in the background. Alright but I always struggle with lambic.

On tap at The Trappist in Oakland.  Somewhat hazy golden-orange color with minimal head.   The aroma is nice and funky with barnyard, lemon, and cereal grains, with a hint of rubber.  The flavor is little rubbery, maybe with a bit of diacetyl.  Good funkiness, oak, and pale malt character though.  Medium-bodied and flat, more or less, which is not a bad thing for an unblended lambic.  A fine beer but does not quite stand up to some of the better examples of the style.

Draft. Amber beer with no head. Oak and tart aroma with light malt. oak and earthy flavor with light tartness, light malt, and light funkiness. Medium bodied. Oak and earth linges with tartness, light malt, and a light fruitiness.

Draught @ Th. 4th. Alvinne Craft Beer Festival (ACBF) 2011, De Kasteelhoeve, Doorniksesteenweg 314, Outrijve (Avelgem), Belgium.Clear medium orange color with a small to average, frothy, fair lacing, fully diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, fruity, sour, barnyard, sour green grape, grape, wood. Flavor is light heavy sweet and light to moderate acidic with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat. A good balance lambic - well done Alex >;O) [20110304]

FUnky aroma.  Clear-gold with almost no head.  Tart with nice wood character; refreshing.

Notes: On tap at Alvinne CBF 11 (3 yr Boon base?).
[3/4/11] Draught at ACBF 2011. Hazy orange. Aroma of barnyard and citrus. Sour bretty flavor with some lemon. Flat and medium-bodied. Nice Stuff.
Draught at ACBF 2011. Clear golden - no head. Wooden, sourish, acid notes, dryness, grape fruits, earthy, orange, bretty notes, barnyard, oakey. Nice.
Draught @ ACBF 2011. Orange coloured. Unclear. No head. Is sour and grapy, full of earht notes and barnyard. Is quite full bodied. Ends on a bretty sour note and is quite citric and refreshing.
Tap at ACBF 2011. Slightly fruity aroma, very clean. Flavor is smooth. Well balanced lambik. Nice.

Draught at ACBF 2011.
Cloudy orange coloured with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of berries with acidic notes.
Fruity and light acidic flavour of berries with notes of oak and barnyard.
Tart finish.

From tap at ACBF2011. Pours almost clear and golden orange with no head. Aroma is fruity, brett and citrusy. Dry, bitter and slight acidic. Orange fruity. Ends acidic and dry. Citric and dry wooden finish. Rather wineous lasting impression.

Draught  Surprisingly stable, small rim over pale amber beer. Surprising (sorry, again) mix of liqueur and Bretts, quite some unidentifiable fruit. Barnyard, saddlesoap flavours, fresh citrus, and obvious lambicky Bretts. And balanced at that! Light, refreshing, and light acidburn. Excellent lambic, even if only the nose points directly at the barrels.
